paragraph2069: Replace a XS-2426G-B indoor ONT Safety information
paragraph2072: Read the following safety information before replacing the unit.
paragraph2075: Hazardous electrical voltages and currents can cause serious physical harm or death. Always use insulated tools and follow proper safety precautions when connecting or disconnecting power circuits.
paragraph2076: Make sure all sources of power are turned off and have no live voltages present on feed lines or terminals. Use a voltmeter to measure for voltage before proceeding.
paragraph2077: Always contact the local utility company before connecting the enclosure to the utilities.
paragraph2080: This equipment is ESD sensitive. Proper ESD protections should be used when removing the fiber access cover of the indoor ONT.
paragraph2083: Keep indoor ONTs out of direct sunlight. Prolonged exposure to direct sunlight can damage the unit.
paragraph2084: Note: Observe the local and national laws and regulations that may be applicable to this installation. Observe the following:
paragraph2085: NEC or CEC. Local authorities and practices take precedent when there is conflict between the local standard and the NEC or CEC.
paragraph2086: Indoor ONTs must be installed with cables that are suitably rated and listed for indoor use.
paragraph2089: Use this procedure to replace a XS-2426G-B indoor ONT.

paragraph2171: Fiber cables transmit invisible laser light. To avoid eye damage or blindness, never look directly into fibers, connectors, or adapters.
paragraph2174: Be careful to maintain a bend radius of no less than 1.5 in. (3.8 cm) when connecting the fiber optic cable. Too small of a bend radius in the cable can result in damage to the optic fiber.

paragraph2309: Use the procedures below to use the web-based GUI for the XS-2426G-B in HGU mode. This mode is preset at delivery.
paragraph2310: A home gateway unit (HGU) is a home networking device, used as a gateway to connect devices in the home through fiber to the Internet. An HGU provides a variety of features for the home network including routing and firewall capability. By using the HGU, users can connect all smart equipment in their home, including personal computers, set-top boxes, mobile phones, and other consumer electronics devices, to the Internet.
paragraph2311: The XS-2426G-B ONTs support TLSv1.2 for WEBGUI (HTTPS).
paragraph2313: Open a web browser and enter the IP address of the ONT in the address bar.
paragraph2315: The default gateway IP address must be same as the one printed on the device label. You can connect to this IP address using your web browser after connecting your PC to one of Ethernet ports of the ONT. The static IP address of your PC must be in the same default gateway subnet as the ONT.
paragraph2318: Pressing the Reset button for less than 10 seconds reboots the ONT; pressing the Reset button for 10 seconds resets the ONT to the factory defaults, except for the LOID and SLID.
paragraph2319: Enter your username and password in the Login page, as shown in Figure 8-1, “Web login page” (p. 83).
paragraph2320: The default end-user account name and the default password for this account are printed on the device label. The superadmin account is meant for the Operator and is unique per device. Contact your Nokia representative to obtain the superadmin password based on the serial number on the device.

paragraph4130: ONT configuration file over OMCI Overview
paragraph4143: This procedure describes how to use configuration files over OMCI to configure ONTs. Some advantages include:
paragraph4144: Note: This feature is supported for use with the 7360 ISAM FX and the 7342 ISAM FTTU.
paragraph4147: © 2021 Nokia. Nokia Confidential Information Use subject to agreed restrictions on disclosure and use.
paragraph4155: ONT configuration file over OMCI Supported configuration file types
paragraph4166: The XML-based PRECONFIG file controls the working mechanics of the ONT for various services. The default behavior of different ONTs may vary based on the factory settings. The pre-configuration file includes the factory default value for the residential gateway.
paragraph4167: Note: the pre-configuration file does not work with SFU ONTs; therefore, this feature applies only to Residential Gateway ONTs. The pre-configuration file can be used as is, but Nokia provides its customers with the flexibility to customize the pre-configuration file. This pre-configuration file enables operators to change the default behavior by downloading a customized pre-configuration based on customer inputs. This PRE XML file includes a custom OPERID. The Nokia defined index for the PRECONFIG file is: "PRE"
paragraph4168: The XML-based CFG file updates the configurable parameters (the PRE settings) in the existing PRE file of a deployed ONT, where required. This configuration file enables operators to change the deployed behavior by downloading customized updates in the CFG file.
paragraph4169: This file is used only to modify the parameters in the PRE file; it is not used for service provisioning. No OPERID is required, because the update is based on the OPERID used for the PRE file. The Nokia defined index for the PRECONFIG DELTA file is: "CFG"
paragraph4170: The Voice XML file provides an alternate method for securely downloading voice parameters from the OLT, rather than using FTP (OMCIv1/OMCIv2) or HTTPS (TR-069). Downloading this file makes the applicable changes in the voice parameters. This file enables operators to change the voice behavior by downloading the updated voice XML file. Nokia recommends using this procedure, rather than embedded voice XML files. The Nokia defined index for the Voice XML file is: "XML"
paragraph4172: All Nokia GPON and 10 GPON ONT.
paragraph4174: All Nokia GPON and 10 GPON ONT.
paragraph4175: © 2021 Nokia. Nokia Confidential Information Use subject to agreed restrictions on disclosure and use.
paragraph4178: ONT configuration file over OMCI ONT configuration file over OMCI
paragraph4186: This text-based json script file controls the default behavior of the G.Fast ONT.
paragraph4188: This file includes the provisioning parameters of the G.fast transports layer; it does not include VLAN or QoS provisioning. While the ONT functions well with the default values; they can optionally be customized. While default values can work in VDSL mode, a download file is required for the device to function as a G.fast ONT.
paragraph4189: The Nokia defined index for the G.fast file is: "GFT"
paragraph4192: Nokia provides the raw configuration files, which must be saved by the operator in a TAR file to be uploaded. TAR file names must be unique.
paragraph4193: The filenames of the raw configuration files may not adhere to the naming conventions outlined below. In this case, the files must be renamed to adhere to the naming conventions before the operator generates the TAR file. Filenames are not case-sensitive.

paragraph4236: 9.4.1 Configuring an ONT using a configuration file via legacy method
paragraph4237: Upload the ABCXXXXVER TAR file to the /ONT/ directory in the OLT.
paragraph4238: A maximum of 250 files can be kept in the OLT file system.
paragraph4239: Using OLT commands, download the TAR file to the ONT.
paragraph4240: For OLT commands, refer to the , or the 7342 ISAM FTTU Operation and Maintenance Using TL1 and CLI.
paragraph4243: Note: X can be 1 or 2 unless specified:
paragraph4244: a. If pland-cfgfileX= Disabled and dnload-cfgfileX= Disabled ,
paragraph4245: no file will be downloaded to the ONT.
paragraph4246: b. If pland-cfgfileX=FILENAME1 and dnload-cfgfileX= Disabled ,
paragraph4247: FILENAME1 will be downloaded and FILENAME1 will be made active. An ONT reboot is required.
paragraph4248: c. If pland-cfgfileX=Disabled and dnload-cfgfileX= FILENAME2
paragraph4249: FILENAME2 will be downloaded and FILENAME2 will be made passive. An ONT reboot is not required.
paragraph4250: d. If pland-cfgfileX=FILENAME3 and dnload-cfgfileX= FILENAME 4, the OLT reports an
paragraph4251: error because the filenames are not the same.

paragraph4254: Configure equipment interface pland-cfgfile2=XMLXXXXXX2 and dnload-cfgfile2 XMLXXXXXX2
paragraph4255: Although the OLT permits the above two steps without reporting an error, Nokia does not recommend executing them, because the ONT may exhibit unexpected behavior.

paragraph4260: The ONT will distribute the configuration files to the different services based on the active indication from the OLT and on the Nokia defined index.
paragraph4261: The ONT automatically reboots to apply the configuration files. After the ONT reboots and reports the active version, the OLT completes the file download procedure.

paragraph4269: Generate the TAR file to be uploaded to the OLT.
paragraph4270: Using the raw configuration file(s) provided by Nokia, generate the TAR file as follows:
paragraph4271: a. On a Linux platform, rename the raw configuration file to adhere to the naming convention,
paragraph4272: as described in section 9.3 “Supported configuration file types” (p. 147).
paragraph4273: b. Tar the ABCXXXXVER raw configuration file: tar -cf ABCXXXXVER.tar ABCXXXXVER
paragraph4276: Is the name of the file created in step i.
